div1.p: [Carter] requests books from the Library of Congress.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to G.W. McCoy, March 19, 1925
div1.opener:
Book
Library
/LC
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
March 19, 1925.
Dear Doctor McCoy:
div1.p:
I would be very grateful to you if you could get me, from the Library
of Congress:
1: Historia General y Natural de las Indias etc.
by
Gonzalo Fernandez de Oviedo y Valdés,
Vol. 1.
2: The History and Description of Africa
Leo Africanus,
Published by Hakluyt Society. Vols. 1: 2 and 3.

The books you sent me a short time ago are all ready to go back. They
have been of much use to me.

With best remembrances to youaand yours, in which Laura, who is
writing this, joins
div1.closer:
Sincerely your friend, Surgeon G. W. McCoy, Director,
Hygienic Laboratory,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
Twenty-fifth and E Streets, N. W.
